frameDefinitions: A Speaker states or makes known a future Eventuality on the basis of some Evidence.
A Social_event occurs at which Attendees are present to conduct a social function or joint activity.
Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar Production.
An Entity began its existence in the context of a Origin, which can be a place,  culture, time period, text, etc.
An Agent schedules an Event to take place at a specified Scheduled_time and Place.
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
frameExamples: The Weather Centre <t>predicted</t> that it would be warmer but wet for the weekend.
Sue threw a <t>party</t> for Bob's birthday.
Steven Spielberg <t>directed</t> several films for Universal Pictures.
The Christian <t>origin</t> of this quote is from Isaiah 22.
Gina <t>scheduled</t> a dentist appointment for Monday in Berkeley.
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a prediction.

This role marks expressions that indicate an event or state that is predicted to occur or hold at a future time. A single <fen>Eventuality</fen> may be expressed discontinuously in a raising construction. This role is also used for expressions that denote entities with variable attributes about which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes predictions.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the prediction.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the prediction pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <m>about</m>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the prediction is made.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the prediction.
This role identifies the <fen>Social_event</fen> itself.
<fen>Attendee</fen> is used for the people who come to the <fen>Social_event</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>.
The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants.
An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>.
Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
This role indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made.
In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen>
The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.
A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production.  In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.
This role indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made.
This role indicates the location of production.
The item whose <fen>Origin</fen> is under discussion.
The place or culture where the <fen>Entity</fen> was produced.
The sentient being who schedules an <fen>Event</fen> to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The incident that the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled to take place at a <fen>Time</fen> and <fen>Place</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Event</fen> is scheduled to take place.
This role describes the time at which the scheduling occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> has scheduled the <fen>Event</fen> to take place.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The institute</fex> forecast an increase in leisure spending of 15 per cent.
Predicting <fex>the weather</fex> is risky business.
The events that would occur over the next several years had been predicted <fex>in the Bible</fex>.
John predicted <fex>last year</fex> that he would be finished by October.
Greenman predicted <fex>at a small dinner party</fex> that the market would rise again.
The department <fex><t>picnic</t></fex> was lots of fun.
<fex>The whole group</fex> attended the party.
<fex>John Williams</fex> composed the soundtrack to Star Wars.
Ralph Smith produced <fex>the off-Broadway hit 'Why Is My Name Ralph?'</fex>.
<fex>Hollywood</fex> director
Even desperate producers would never produce a film <fex>for that television station</fex>.
The latest performance produced <fex>by The Umbrella Thesbians</fex> was a major hit in France.
He produces <fex>for television</fex>
This particular scene was shot <fex>with a local choir and dancers</fex>.
Silence of the Lambs was filmed <fex>in 1991</fex>.
The documentary was shot <fex>on location</fex>.
<fex>I</fex> set up a meeting with Carlos on Monday.
I'd like to set up <fex>a meeting with Mr. Hofmann</fex>.
Maria scheduled the appointment <fex>for Monday</fex>.
Gina scheduled a dentist appointment for Monday <fex>in Berkeley</fex>.
<fex>The medicine man</fex> performs this ritual
<fex>Joe</fex> received communion.
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
We baptise children <fex>with holy water</fex>
They performed a <fex>fertility</fex> ritual.
We performed the traditional <fex>marriage</fex> rites
The priest blessed <fex>the wine</fex>
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Utterly Utterly Live at the Shaftesbury Theatre: Comic Relief'
